label: Bill of Sale for fourteen slaves to James Hartley of Colleton District, South Carolina, October 5, 1807
description: A bill of sale to James Hartley for the purchase of eleven slaves, issued by the Sheriff's Office in Colleton District, Charleston, South Carolina.

metadata.label: Description
metadata.value: A bill of sale to James Hartley for the purchase of eleven slaves, issued by the Sheriff's Office in Colleton District, Charleston, South Carolina.

metadata.label: Transcript
metadata.value:
Charleston: Printed by W.P. YOUNG

State of South Carolina] SHERIFF's OFFICE.
COLLETON DISTRICT.

Thos. Wilson Mortgage
To 
James Hartley

KNOW all Men by these presents that by virtue of the above writ of fieri facias
to me directed, as Sheriff of Colleton district, in the state aforesaid, and regularly
lodged in my office, the property of Thomas Wilson Esquire
was levied on, and taken under execution;
afterwards the property so levied on, was legally advertised for sale in the month
of September and on the fifth day of October, in the
year of our Lord, one thousand eight hundred
and seven being the first Monday in said month,
between the hours of eleven in the forenoon, and three in the afternoon, on said day
fourteen Negro slaves, Virg: Cato, Amaritta,
Aby, Myley, Betsy, Jenny, Sampson, and
Sevin children, namely Israel, Monday, Joan
Phillis, Eliza, Sue and Sally...-

Sold on account of the above execution,being the property so levied on, was
disposed of at public auction, to Thomas Drayton Esquire
for the sum of Two thousand, nine hundred and
fifty six dollars- he, at that price or sum, being the highest and last
KNOWN That I have received from the said Thomas Drayton
Esquire the aforesaid sum of Two thousand nine hundred
and fifty six dollars-
and in pursuance thereof, I have delivered to him the said fourteen Negro
slaves Virg: Cato, Amaritta, Aby, Myley, 
Betsy, Jenny, Sampson, and sevin [seven] children, Virg: 
Israel, Monday, Joan Phillis, Eliza, Sue and Sally-
according to the usage and custom in such cases, in the state aforesaid.

IN TESTIMONY WHEREOF, I have hereunto set my Hand and Seal, the Day
and Year before written.

Sealed, Signed and Delivered
in the Presence of

John Fabian

M. Youngblood
Sheriff Colleton [District]
